net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.adapter

Class UiWidgetAdapterGwt<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.adapter.AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.adapter.AbstractUiWidgetAdapterWithEvents<WIDGET,EventAdapterGwt>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.adapter.UiWidgetAdapterGwt<WIDGET>
  • Type Parameters:
    WIDGET - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getToplevelWidget().
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAltText, AttributeReadAttribute, AttributeReadColumnSpan, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHeightInRows, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadLengthProperty, AttributeReadMaximumTextLength, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadSizeInPixel, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadUrl, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeWriteAttribute, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeWriteLengthProperty, AttributeWriteOnlyAttribute, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, UiWidgetAdapter, HandlerRegistrationCollector, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, Accessibility
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetAdapterGwtMenuItemBase, UiWidgetAdapterGwtMenuItemSeparator, UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidget

    public abstract class UiWidgetAdapterGwt<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>
extends AbstractUiWidgetAdapterWithEvents<WIDGET,EventAdapterGwt>
implements AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>, HandlerRegistrationCollector
    This is the implementation of UiWidgetAdapter using GWT based on UIObject.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • TAB_INDEX_NONE

        protected static final int TAB_INDEX_NONE
        The tab index to remove from tab-order. Should actually be -1. See GWT bug 8323.

      • getToplevelWidget

        protected static final <W extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject> W getToplevelWidget(UiWidget widget,
                                                                                              Class<W> widgetType)
        This method gets the native widget of the given widget.
        Type Parameters:
        W - is the generic type of widgetType.
        Parameters:
        widget - is the UiWidget to "unwrap".
        widgetType - is the expected type of the native widget.
        Returns:
        the native widget.

      • getActiveWidget

        public com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject getActiveWidget()
        This method gets the active widget. For simple cases this will be the same as AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getToplevelWidget(). In more complex scenarios the toplevel widget may only be a container widget and this method returns a child that represents the active part.
        Overrides:
        getActiveWidget in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>
        Returns:
        the active widget.

      • setStyles

        public void setStyles(String styles)
        This method clears all styles and sets them to the given styles. This will also update the primary style.
        Specified by:
        setStyles in interface AttributeWriteStyles
        Parameters:
        styles - are the styles of this object. Either a single style or a list of styles separated by whitespaces. Use the empty string to unset all styles.

      • addStyle

        public boolean addStyle(String style)
        This method adds the given style to the styles.
        Specified by:
        addStyle in interface AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced
        Overrides:
        addStyle in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>
        Parameters:
        style - is the style to add. If this style is already contained in the styles, this will have no effect.
        Returns:
        true if the styles has actually been added, false if it was already present before.

      • removeStyle

        public boolean removeStyle(String style)
        This method removes the given style from the styles.
        Specified by:
        removeStyle in interface AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced
        Overrides:
        removeStyle in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>
        Parameters:
        style - is the style to remove. If this style is NOT contained in the styles, this will have no effect.
        Returns:
        true if the given style has actually been removed, false otherwise (if it was NOT present).

        See Also:

      • isStyleDeltaSupported

        public boolean isStyleDeltaSupported()
        This method determines if the style delta operations AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced.addStyle(String), AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced.removeStyle(String) and AttributeWritePrimaryStyle.setPrimaryStyle(String) are supported by this widget adapter. Otherwise such operations are always performed via the AttributeWriteStyles.setStyles(String) method. If supported the delta operations are preferred as they are assumed to be more efficient.
        Specified by:
        isStyleDeltaSupported in interface UiWidgetAdapter
        Overrides:
        isStyleDeltaSupported in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>
        Returns:
        true if style delta operations are supported, false otherwise.

      • getLength

        public Length getLength(LengthProperty property)
        This method gets the Length for the given LengthProperty of this object.
        E.g. the call of getLength(LengthProperty.WIDTH) will return the same result as AttributeReadSize.getWidth(). Unlike AttributeReadSize this method provides access to additional properties such as e.g. LengthProperty.MIN_WIDTH or LengthProperty.MAX_HEIGHT.
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface AttributeReadLengthProperty
        Parameters:
        property - is the LengthProperty identifying the actual property to get.
        Returns:
        the requested Length. Will be Length.ZERO if undefined (NOT set).

      • setLength

        public void setLength(LengthProperty property,
                      Length length)
        This method sets the specified length of this object.
        E.g. the call of setLength(LengthProperty.WIDTH, value) will return the same result as setWidth(value).
        Specified by:
        setLength in interface AttributeWriteLengthProperty
        Parameters:
        property - is the LengthProperty identifying the actual property to set.
        length - is the new length to set.

      • getWidthInPixel

        public double getWidthInPixel()
        This method gets the width of this object in pixels.
        NOTE:
        The result will typically be an int value. However, to be compatible with Length.getAmount() and with some underlying native toolkits we use double to prevent potential information loss.
        Specified by:
        getWidthInPixel in interface AttributeReadSizeInPixel
        Returns:
        the width.

      • getHeightInPixel

        public double getHeightInPixel()
        This method gets the height of this object in pixels.
        NOTE:
        The result will typically be an int value. However, to be compatible with Length.getAmount() and with some underlying native toolkits we use double to prevent potential information loss.
        Specified by:
        getHeightInPixel in interface AttributeReadSizeInPixel
        Returns:
        the height.

      • getSizeElement

        protected com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element getSizeElement()
        Returns:
        the sized Element used by getLength(LengthProperty) and setLength(LengthProperty, Length).

      • createEventAdapter

        protected EventAdapterGwt createEventAdapter(UiFeatureEvent source,
                                             UiHandlerEvent sender)
        This method creates the AbstractUiWidgetAdapterWithEvents.getEventAdapter() instance. It should to be implemented by the top-level widget-adapter class specific for a native UI toolkit. It may further be overridden to use a sub-class instead when more specific behavior is needed.
        Specified by:
        createEventAdapter in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapterWithEvents<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject,EventAdapterGwt>
        Parameters:
        source - is the source of the events (typically UiWidget).
        sender - is the sender of events (an adapter that delegates to the individual handlers/listeners).
        Returns:
        the new event adapter.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(UiWidgetImage imageWidget)
        This method sets the image of this object. A previously set image will be replaced.
        Specified by:
        setImage in interface AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>
        Parameters:
        imageWidget - is the new image or null to remove the image.

      • getImageParentElement

        protected com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element getImageParentElement()
        This method gets the parent-Element where a potential image is attached.
        Returns:
        the parent-Element for an image.

      • getImage

        public UiWidgetImage getImage()
        This method gets the image of this object. If the image is attached to an object with arbitrary other features and has a smaller size, it is typically called icon.
        Specified by:
        getImage in interface AttributeReadImage<UiWidgetImage>
        Overrides:
        getImage in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject>
        Returns:
        the image or null if no image is defined.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This method disposes this object. The resources of the object are deallocated and the object can not be used or displayed anymore. If this is an object of the UI (user interface) it will be detached.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface AttributeWriteDisposed

        This method creates an absolute URL from the given relativePath.
        Specified by:
        createAbsoluteImageUrl in interface UiWidgetAdapter
        Parameters:
        relativePath - is the relative path (URL suffix) to the image.
        Returns:
        the absolute URL.
        See Also:
        UiConfiguration.getTheme()

      • addHandlerRegistration

        public void addHandlerRegistration(com.google.gwt.event.shared.HandlerRegistration registration)
        This method is to be called with the HandlerRegistration for all permanent handlers. This allows to remove them on disposal.
        Specified by:
        addHandlerRegistration in interface HandlerRegistrationCollector
        Parameters:
        registration - is the HandlerRegistration to add.
